accused.name: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
accused.spouse_name: Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey

confession.seduction_context: Had been living in father's house at la Bourgonce, and was hungry and miserable about dearth they were enduring. Promised to give her enough to eat, and ensure that she did not want.

witnesses.name: Bastienne veuve Jean Mathieu
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: former employer (24 years earlier she had been maid in their house)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Colatte was angry because she did not receive plate of millot which she thought was her due after witness's mother died

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same day child burned, next day given drink and died within 24 hours

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey

testimony.quarrel_subject: Complicated affair in which husband of accused was supposed to make cart for Ydoux of Blairville, in payment of debts, but he was so slow that latter passed job to husband of witness (also wheelwright) and obliged them to pay over money to him

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: husband fell ill with fever lasting 18 weeks, recovered after she consoled him, but died 3 years later

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband had to pass through her garden to cut hay in a small field, and damaged plants slightly; she cursed him over this

testimony.quarrel_subject: He had obliged her with other neighbours to contribute to cost of a stone surround for his well, which they all used for their animals, and she had uttered various curses on this occasion

timeline.subject: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
timeline.details: Initial interrogation; denied all charges strongly and 'arrogamment invectivé de parolles injurieuses, pleins de dementys'

timeline.subject: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
timeline.details: No reproaches to witnesses, but firm denials

timeline.subject: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
timeline.details: Procureur for ban d'Etival asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire. Notes that she had been confronted with Margueritte femme Cesar le Charpentier

timeline.subject: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews on hands and feet without effect. While head being shaved, found as if dead with throat contorted and face black as iron. Given mixture of wine and holy water by force. Confessed as soon as racked. Brought back that afternoon, confirmed earlier confessions

timeline.subject: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
timeline.details: Confirmed earlier confessions, but would still add nothing. Confronted with Anthoinette and Jeannon, confirmed accusations despite their denials

timeline.subject: Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
Colatte veuve Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves. At first asked for reiteration of confessions, but then saw act of previous day, and decided this was not needed

accomplices_named.name: Margueritte veuve Cesar le Charpentier
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat 3 or 4 times; she had accused Colatte

accomplices_named.name: Cesar (son of Margueritte veuve Cesar le Charpentier)
Anthoinette femme Jean des Courtz
accomplices_named.context: Added to list of accomplices in afternoon session of torture

prior_accusations.accuser_location: being taken to St Dié for execution
prior_accusations.context: When witness Idatte's late father was taking woman convicted of witchcraft to St Dié for execution, that woman accused Colatte as accomplice

notable_quotes.speaker: Colatte de la Ruelle
notable_quotes.french: J'ay encor un pain (en despit d'elle) que son marit m'a donné, il n'est pas si mauvais qu'elle
notable_quotes.english: I still have a loaf (in spite of her) that her husband gave me, he is not as bad as she is
notable_quotes.context: Said when Jean Moulat gave her a loaf to turn away her ill will after quarrel with his wife at the mill

notable_quotes.speaker: Court record about Colatte
notable_quotes.french: nous a fort arrogamment invectivé de parolles injurieuses, pleins de dementys
notable_quotes.english: very arrogantly abused us with injurious words, full of denials
notable_quotes.context: Description of her behavior at end of initial interrogation

relationships.person1: Colas de la Ruelle alias Girey
relationships.evidence_text: 7 or 8 years before her husband, who was wheelwright, owed witness money

economic_context.details: Multiple disputes over cart-making debts involving accused's wheelwright husband. Witness 1 mentions husband owed her money and she asked him to make cart in payment. Witness 3 describes complicated affair where accused's husband was supposed to make cart for Ydoux of Blairville in payment of debts, but was so slow the job was passed to witness's husband. In confession, accused states she was 'hungry and miserable about dearth they were enduring' at time of seduction.

harms_catalog.victim_name: first child of Bastienne veuve Jean Mathieu
harms_catalog.harm_description: Child put hands in hot water and was burned; next day asked for drink and was given cup with wine deceased had drunk during illness. Child immediately fell very ill, and died within 24 hours

child was given cup with a little of the wine deceased had drunk during illness

refused bread and apples he was offered for fear of being bewitched
Multiple disputes over wheelwright husband making carts in payment of debts
she sent her some lard and made payment for son who kept animals

obliged her with other neighbours to contribute to cost of a stone surround for his well, which they all used for their animals
devil gave her black powder to kill; threw powder on pig

Was given mixture of wine and holy water by force during torture

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete 4-page trial record with detailed witness testimony. Some ambiguity about exact timeline of events, particularly regarding when accused's husband died relative to trial (stated as '3 or 4 weeks earlier'). The trial record mentions confrontation with 'Margueritte femme Cesar le Charpentier' who is also named as accomplice seen at sabbat - this suggests she may have been tried simultaneously or was already imprisoned. Economic status assessed as 'poor' based on confession statement about being 'hungry and miserable about dearth' and working as servant. Multiple witnesses corroborate death of Jean Moulat's wife (witnesses 3, 5, 9). Sister's execution at Nompatelize mentioned by multiple witnesses (4, 7) with timeline of 8-9 years earlier. Notable that accused only confessed to one malefice (death of child) despite extensive testimony about many harms.
